modules.description: Tracks and updates frame rate metrics, updating a reference to the last recorded frames per second. It maintains counters for total frames and calculates the current frame rate. The module renders the frame rate as text using a Cairo context at specified screen coordinates.

Provides functions to render shapes, handle user input, and animate graphical elements. Works with types such as colors, vectors, and event streams to build interactive visual content. Enables creation of educational visualizations and simple games by combining geometric primitives with dynamic behavior.

Tracks frame rate metrics, maintaining counters for total frames and calculating the current frames per second. It updates a reference with the latest frame rate and renders the value as text using a Cairo context at specified coordinates. The module provides a way to monitor and display performance data in real time. It supports operations like resetting counters and retrieving the current frame rate value.

This module offers operations for creating and transforming geometric shapes, including polygons, images, and text, with support for color manipulation, scaling, rotation, and fading. It works with numerical values, coordinate systems, color definitions, and game-state types to enable interactive graphical applications. Specific use cases include building animations, mapping keyboard inputs to visual elements, and managing dynamic visual compositions.
